column1: What is the output of the following code?~~int x = 15;~if (x == 10)~    System.out.println("x is 10");~else if (x == 15)~    System.out.println("x is 15");~else if (x > 20)~    System.out.println("x is greater than 20");~else~    System.out.println("No match");$
Which of the following is true about an else block?$
column2: It must always come after an if block.$
column3: It can be placed before the if block.$
column4: It can execute code even if the if condition is true.$
column5: It must always follow an else if block.$
column7: 'else' must always come after an if block

column2: what will be printed?~~int num = 9;~if (num % 2 == 0)~    System.out.println("Even");~else~    System.out.println("Odd");$

column2: what will be printed?~~int x = 8;~if (x > 5)~    if (x > 10)~        System.out.println("x is greater than 10");~    else if (x > 7)~        System.out.println("x is greater than 7 but less than or equal to 10");~    else~        System.out.println("x is less than or equal to 7");$
column4: x is greater than 7 but less than or equal to 10$
column5: x is less than or equal to 7$
column8: 8 is greater than 7 but less than or equal to 10

column1: Which of the following is the correct way to check if a variable x is between 10 and 20
column8: Because x needs to be more than 10 and less than 20.

column1: What is the output for the following program?~~int score = 85;~if (score >= 90) {~    System.out.println("A");~} else if (score >= 80) {~    if (score > 84) {~        System.out.println("A-");~    } else {~        System.out.println("B+");~    }~}$
column7: 85 is more than 84 and less than 90.
